Class Volume

A generic Volume component holding a VolumeProfile.

Inheritance
System.Object
Volume
Namespace: UnityEngine.Rendering
Assembly: cs.temp.dll.dll
Syntax
public class Volume : MonoBehaviour

Fields

blendDistance

The outer distance to start blending from. A value of 0 means no blending and Unity applies the Volume overrides immediately upon entry.

Declaration
public float blendDistance
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

isGlobal

Specifies whether to apply the Volume to the entire Scene or not.

Declaration
public bool isGlobal
Field Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

priority

The Volume priority in the stack. A higher value means higher priority. This supports negative values.

Declaration
public float priority
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

sharedProfile

The shared Profile that this Volume uses. Modifying sharedProfile changes every Volumes that uses this Profile and also changes the Profile settings stored in the Project.

Declaration
public VolumeProfile sharedProfile
Field Value
Type Description
VolumeProfile
Remarks

You should not modify Profiles that sharedProfile returns. If you want to modify the Profile of a Volume, use profile instead.

See Also
profile

weight

The total weight of this volume in the Scene. 0 means no effect and 1 means full effect.

Declaration
public float weight
Field Value
Type Description
System.Single

Properties

profile

Gets the first instantiated VolumeProfile assigned to the Volume. Modifying profile changes the Profile for this Volume only. If another Volume uses the same Profile, this clones the shared Profile and starts using it from now on.

Declaration
public VolumeProfile profile { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
VolumeProfile
Remarks

This property automatically instantiates the Profile and make it unique to this Volume so you can safely edit it via scripting at runtime without changing the original Asset in the Project. Note that if you pass your own Profile, you must destroy it when you finish using it.

See Also
sharedProfile

Methods

HasInstantiatedProfile()

Checks if the Volume has an instantiated Profile or if it uses a shared Profile.

Declaration
public bool HasInstantiatedProfile()
Returns
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if the profile has been instantiated.

profile
sharedProfile
